intro: Sedum dubium, commonly known as the common stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is a perennial succulent that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has fleshy, upright stems and leaves that are usually green or reddish, depending on light exposure. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically yellow or orange, appearing in late summer. Sedum dubium is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy and low-maintenance plant for gardens and rocky landscapes.
